Campaign Television Advertisement Project

  • Overview

Overview

The Campaign Television Advertisement Project helps researchers access one of the largest (and most complete) archives of campaign advertisements. Building upon the Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive at the University of Oklahoma, this website will allow researchers to query these ads for many things related to social science research. In total, researchers will be able to access information about 120,383 political advertisements, beginning in 1912 and ending in 2018. Some examples of these ads are provided below.

News

  • Announcing NSF grant
  • Welcome to new student staff

Sample Political Advertisements

Charles Nesbitt [Democratic] 1972 Campaign Ad "Capital Punishment"
William W. Greenhalgh [Democratic] 1970 Campaign Ad "Berry"
Norma Scott [R-KS] 1972 Campaign Ad "Clerk tasks"
